intro: Montanoa andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's montanoa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Montanoa andersonii is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
